results.title: South India
results.creator_credit: Jez Higham, Emma Cahwac and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro explores India’s southern tip, travelling through the state of Tamil Nadu, and then on to tropical Kerala where she tours its famed network of backwaters and canals. Justine ends her journey on the rarely visited Lakshadweep islands in the middle of the Arabian Sea. Other activities covered in the journey include: eating at a vegetarian restaurant where 3,000 customers lunch everyday, riding on a bullock cart to a Hindu temple at Tiravanamali, travelling to an elephant sanctuary and bathing them, and visiting one of India’s few female gurus who has hugged over ten million people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jez Higham, Emma Cahwac and Pilot Films

results.title: Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro travels off the beaten track on a tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands. She visits hot springs heated by a volcano, views the countryside from the roof of a train and almost tries roast guinea pig. A highlight of the journey is a visit to the Amazon forest, guided by the indigenous people of the area. The Galapagos Islands were made famous by Charles Darwin in developing his theory of evolution and are home to a fascinating diversity of wildlife, with many species found nowhere else in the world.

results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.

results.title: Sound in View (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Technology”.
A visual depiction of sound waves including digital and modulated formats. The aim of this program is to teach the meanings of a number of terms used to describe the signals used in telecommunications.

results.title: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters
results.brief_description: ‘Living with disaster’ is a major project by ACMI in collaboration with the Attorney General’s Department through its Emergency Management division and the CFA, in order to capture stories of young people who have survived natural disasters.

results.title: Storm at sea, tornado on land
results.creator_credit: Kelly Lennon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
As Kelly Lennon ate breakfast, she knew it was going to be a miserable day. What followed was so terrifying that it was only when her mother returned that she felt safe.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: A Trail of destruction
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The whole thing probably lasted about twenty seconds, but for Jeremy Somerville, his family and community, it is an event they will never forget.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Friendship beats the storm
results.creator_credit: Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Best friends Kiera Chapman and Eliza Goldsmith have been through quite a lot together. When Chapman’s family took shelter during the torando that hit Lennox Head in 2010, Goldsmith cut her feet running over to see if Chapman was ok. As they weathered the storm together, they share the experience with their family, community and with each other.
